annotations.description: The fans in the stadium certainly won't regret buying tickets as they witnessed a great game today. The home side were superior in this game. It was obvious that the hosts tried to outplay their opponents with some passing football, while the visitors focused on counter attacking play.

annotations.label: whistle
annotations.description: That's the end of the match.

Andres Iniesta (Barcelona) covers his face with his hands after wasting a promising chance. He takes the rebound on the edge of the box but blazes the ball high over the crossbar. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Atl. Madrid.

annotations.description: Neymar (Barcelona) works the corner short instead of sending the ball into the penalty area.

annotations.label: y-card
annotations.description: Jordi Alba (Barcelona) is shown a deserved yellow card for saying too much to the referee.

Madrid) leaps highest around the penalty spot to meet a cross from the free kick and produces a promising goal bound header towards the top right corner, but Marc Andre ter Stegen pulls off a fine save to deny him. annotations.label: y-card
annotations.description: Luis Suarez (Barcelona) makes a really bad tackle on his opponent and is relieved when the referee only shows him a yellow card.
Luis Suarez (Barcelona) should know this behaviour is beyond the rules. He was too careless with his challenge and left David Fernandez Borbalan no option but to blow his whistle.

annotations.label: soccer-ball
annotations.description: Goal! That was a fantastic finish by Angel Correa (Atl. Madrid) from just outside the box. He wasted little time in getting away a bullet of a shot that flew past the goalkeeper into the bottom left corner of the net.

Antoine Griezmann (Atl. Madrid) wasted a huge opportunity! The fans already began to celebrate as he unleashed a powerful shot from the edge of the box after a brilliant solo effort. The ball went towards the bottom left corner, but Marc Andre ter Stegen made a crucial save!

annotations.label: whistle
annotations.description: The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.

We have seen a few chances and nice movements, but the overall impression of the game is rather average and not hugely entertaining. The home side is dominant and dictating the tempo of the game, mainly because of their work rate and accurate passing. The home side are keeping possession of the ball with some short passes, while the visitors are waiting to open up their defence and hit them swiftly on the break.

Luis Suarez (Barcelona) goes on a mazy run and tries his luck with a mid range strike, but one of the defending players steps in and makes a block.

Yannick Carrasco (Atl. Madrid) makes a good run with the ball, but his shot from the edge of the penalty area goes just wide of the left post. Terrific solo effort, though. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Barcelona.
Marc Andre ter Stegen displays his ability to read the game and clears the danger after Antoine Griezmann (Atl. Madrid) threatened to latch onto a through ball from just outside the box.
Ivan Rakitic (Barcelona) races towards goal but the defender gets back well to make a challenge.
Kevin Gameiro (Atl. Madrid) commits a foul and David Fernandez Borbalan immediately signals a free kick.
The defence had a hard time blocking out the strike from Lionel Messi (Barcelona). He didn't hesitate and finished from outside the box right after he had received a pass from his teammate.

Luis Suarez (Barcelona) finds himself in a promising position after receiving a beautiful cross from the side, but the opposition defence is ready and one of the defenders averts the threat with a quick interception.
A neat pass is well received by Andres Iniesta (Barcelona), who is lurking on the edge of the box and strikes the ball on goal. The goalkeeper makes a decent save to block his shot.
Sergi Roberto (Barcelona) dinks a cross into the box in an attempt to find one of his teammates, but the defence manages to clear.
Filipe Luis (Atl. Madrid) pounced on a rebound on the edge of the box and his shot goes a whisker over the crossbar. The ball goes out of play and Barcelona will have a goal kick.

Jan Oblak makes a brilliant save! Lionel Messi (Barcelona) easily weaves through the defence and unleashes a shot from just outside of the box. His effort goes towards the bottom left corner but is saved by the keeper!
